thread.title: Chilling discovery forces youth football league to cancel season

title: Chilling discovery forces youth football league to cancel season
text:
Chilling discovery forces youth football league to cancel season This article originally appeared on TODAY.com. Post to Facebook Chilling discovery forces youth football league to cancel season This article originally appeared on TODAY.com.  //on.11alive.com/1ROVCgT   1   Chilling discovery forces youth football league to cancel season USA Today Network 9:01 p.m. EDT October 17, 2015 College football 146 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
This article originally appeared on TODAY.com . 
(TODAY) -- A little league season has been cancelled. It wasn’t cancelled because of a lack of funds or a problem on the field, but what league officials found when they arrived on Tuesday. 
It was something that would chill the average person to the bone. 
Live ammunition was strewn across the field and a closer inspection proved that it wasn’t a coincidence. 
On each shell was the name of a league official. That’s when they called police. 
The season is over in the Mount Pleasant Area Junior Football League in Pennsylvania and now investigators, players and families are asking the same question: Why? 
So is this a case of irate parents and just how commonplace are these outlandish scenarios?
